name: African Wildlife Foundation
membership: The International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN)
memberOrga: AWF is a pan-African organisation, thus does not have membership directly in European countries.
goal: The African Wildlife Foundation has a vision of an Africa where human development includes thriving wildlife and extensive wild lands as a cultural and economic asset for Africa’s future generations. AWF’s mission is to ensure that wildlife and wild lands thrive in modern Africa. Our strategy is to support leadership at all levels in their efforts to stabilize wildlife habitats, protect wildlife and wild lands, and to eliminate illegal wildlife trade.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Environment, External Relations, Foreign affairs and security policy, International co-operation and development
euInitiatives:
Post Cotonou Agreement Negotiations between the EU, ACP countries and the AU
ACP-EU Parliamentary Delegation
Delegation for the Pan African Parliament
Post Aichi target and strategy negotiations
EU Multiannual Financial Framework
EU Development Cooperation
EU Environment
